Descendants of Theodorus Mellott

 

[ Click on the red arrow for a shortcut to the list of family trees on this site

s Click on the blue question mark for assistance in navigating among family trees

 

Click here to view Mellott family tree in Outline format

 

First Generation

 

1. Theodorus Mellott [6582], son of John M. Mellott [6704] and Sarah Stillwell [72], was born on February 7, 1752 in Egg Harbor City, Atlantic, New Jersey, USA,1 died on August 27, 1840 in Monroe County, Ohio at age 88, and was buried in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

Theodorus was a veteran of the American Revolution. He fought with Captain Henry Rush's Company of the Bedford County Militia.

He was buried at East Sunsbury Baptist Church Cemetery, Monroe County, Ohio in Monroe County, Ohio.

 

Theodorus married Living

 

Children from this marriage were:

 

2 F i. Sarah Mellott [6585] was born in 1775.

 

Sarah married Living

 

Sarah next married Living

 

+ 3 M ii. John Noah Mellott [6586] was born on January 24, 1776 in Pennsylvania and died on May 8, 1845 in Monroe County, Ohio at age 69.

 

+ 4 M iii. Peter Mellott [6588] was born about 1779 in Pennsylvania 3 and died on December 11, 1863 in Monroe County, Ohio about age 84.

 

+ 5 M iv. Theodorus Mellott [6657] was born on February 14, 1788 in Pennsylvania 4 and died on March 20, 1855 in Monroe County, Ohio at age 67.

 

6 F v. Rachel Mellott [6589] was born in 1790.

 

+ 7 M vi. Jacob Mellott [6590] was born on October 29, 1794 in Pennsylvania 5 and died on April 14, 1855 in Monroe County, Ohio at age 60.

 

8 F vii. Ida Mellott [6591] was born in 1795.

 

9 F viii. Abegail Mellott [6592] was born in 1796.

He was buried at East Sunsbury Baptist Church Cemetery, Monroe County, Ohio in Monroe County, Ohio.

88. John S. Mellott [8180] (Noah 3, John Noah 2, Theodorus 1) was born on April 1, 1840 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.14, 90

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on September 25, 1850 in Harrison Township, Bartholomew County, Indiana, USA.89

He served in the Civil War with 7th West Virginia Infantry Regiment from November 11, 1861 to November 17, 1864. He was wounded at Gettysburg, Jul 3 1863, on the right side of the lower jaw. He received a second wound in the fight on Rapidan River, Feb 16 1864, in the right leg; it was a flesh wound. A third wound was received at Hatche's Run, Oct 28 1864; he was wounded between the spine and the right hip.

 

 

He appeared in the census on June 10, 1880 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.90

498 M ii. Perry Wesley Mellott [9025] was born on February 22, 1923 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA and died on January 23, 1998 in Barnesville, Belmont, Ohio, USA at age 74.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published. Perry Wesley Mellott, 74, Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, formerly of Harper Ridge Road, Woodsfield, died Friday, Jan. 23, 1998 in Barnesville hospital. He was born Feb. 22, 1923 near Beallsville, a son of the late James and Alice Baker Mellott. He was a retired employee of Baker Farm Equipment near Lewisville, attended United Methodist Church, Jerusalem, a member of American Legion Post 768, Beallsville and was an army veteran of World War II. In addition to his parents he was preceded in death by a sister, Emma Thornberry. Surviving are his wife, Lydia Persons Mellott of Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center; two sons, James and Herman Mellott both of Woodsfield; a daughter Molly Fogle of Fayetteville. NC; a step-daughter, Rosalee Manges of Quaker City; a brother James Mellott of Beallsville; two sisters, Clarabell Baker of New Castle and Bessie Carpenter of Wilson; 10 grandchildren; a great-grandson. Funeral services will be held today at 2p.m. at Harper Funeral Home, 52728 Ohio Ave. Beallsville, with the Rev. Edward Emory Jr. officiating. Burial follows in Boston Cemetery, Boston, Ohio, with full military honors conducted by American Legion Post 768, Beallsville.

 

Perry married Living

His obituary was published in the Zanesville Signal on November 22, 1938 in Zanesville, Muskingum, Ohio, USA. Short funeral services were held this afternoon at the home of his daughter, Mrs. A. C. Baker, Route 4, for Joseph Foutty, 79, who died at the Baker home Sunday morning. His death terminated an extended illness. Surviving are several children. His wife preceded him in death in July 1927.

290. Tollie Otto Mellott [9555] (Crawford 4, Amos 3, John Noah 2, Theodorus 1) was born on June 18, 1873 in Morrow County, Ohio and died on June 11, 1924 in Morrow County, Ohio at age 50.

766 M i. Earl D. Mellott [12447] was born on March 29, 1913 in Morrow County, Ohio, died on December 27, 2000 in Seneca County, Ohio at age 87, and was buried in Greenlawn Cemetery, Seneca County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Advertiser-Tribune [online] on December 28, 2000 in Tiffin, Seneca County, Ohio, USA. Earl D. Mellott, 87, formerly of 19 Braden Court, died at 12:20 a.m. Wednesday, Dec. 27, 2000, in St. Francis Home.

He was born March 29, 1913, in Morrow County, to Tollie Otto and Zila L. (Dye) Mellott. In 1935, in Chesterville, Ohio, he married Kathryn Dunn. She died in January 1961. On Sept. 24, 1965, in the Lutheran Church, Tiffin, he married Genevieve S. "Mickey" Wheeler, who survives.

Other survivors include: a son, Ronald E. Mellott of Tiffin; two grandchildren and two great-granddaughters.

Also deceased are three sisters, five brothers and a grandchild

Mr. Mellott, a 1934 member of the Civil Conservation Corp, retired in 1975 as a roter from the Tiffin General Electric Co.

A former member of St. Paul's United Methodist Church, he was a memer of Eagles 402, Moose Lodge 846 and the United Commercial Travelers.

The Rev. John Kirian will conduct the 11 a.m. Saturday service in St. Francis Home Chapel. Burial will be in Greenlawn Cemetery.

Visitation will be 4-6 p.m. Friday in the Hoffmann-Gottfried Funeral Home and at the chapel10 a.m. Saturday until time of the service .

Memorials may be made to St. Francis Home or a charity of the donor's choice.

 

Earl married Living

 

Earl next married Living

+ 773 M i. Frederick G. Mellott [12440] was born on September 19, 1897 in Ohio 333 and died on August 19, 1967 in Morrow County, Ohio 373 at age 69.

 

774 F ii. Sarah E. Mellott [11740] was born on February 26, 1912 in Morrow County, Ohio, died on June 18, 2002 in Edison, Morrow, Ohio, USA at age 90, and was buried in Rivercliff Cemetery, Morrow County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in an article in the Marion Star on September 13, 1929. Thew Baird was chosen president for the year by members of the senior class of the Mt. Gilead high school at the meeting held Wednesday afternoon. Other officers are Wilbur Watson, vice president; Sarah Mellott, secretary and treasurer, and Coach L. T. Bender, class advisor.

 

Members of the junior class names Howard Kline, president; Everett Shipman, vice president and Catherine Stevens, secretary and treasurer. Miss Louise Gooding was named class advisor.

 

Stanley Matthews will head the sophomore class as president. Mildred Peoples, vice president and Helen Jones, secretary and treasurer. Miss Audrey Bretlinger is class advisor.

She graduated from Mt. Gilead High School in 1930 in Morrow County, Ohio.

Her obituary was published in the Snyder Funeral Homes Web Site about June 18, 2002. Sarah E. Mellott Payne, 90, of Co. Rd. 28, Edison, Ohio passed away unexpectedly Tuesday, June 18, 2002 at her home.

She was a lifelong Morrow County resident, where she was born on Feb. 26, 1912, the daughter of the late Clyde and Alvirda Dennis Mellott. She graduated from Mt. Gilead High School in 1930. Sarah worked for the Mt. Gilead Phone Company for 13 years until 1943 when she went to work as a physician's assistant for Dr. Frank Sweeney until 1966 and then for Dr. John (Jack) Sweeney from 1966 until she retired in 1981. She was a member of the Denmark United Methodist Church, the Knit Knot Club, and had previously been active with the Canaan Grange and the Morrow County Crippled Children's Association for many years. She was well know for her love of life and enjoyed very much being around her friends and family.

She is survived by her husband Morris Payne, whom she married Oct. 12, 1934; a niece Marian (Lawrence) Burnell of Edison, OH; great nephews and nieces Dennis & Alice Burnell, Steve & Patti Stansbery, and Steve & LuAnn Bloomfield and their families.

A brother Fred Mellott and a great nephew Larry Burnell also preceded her in death.

Friends may call at the Craven Funeral Home in Mt. Gilead on Wed. evening from 6-8 p.m. Rev. Howard Huston will conduct funeral services there Thursday at 11:00 a.m. Burial will be in Rivercliff Cemetery. Memorial contributions can be made to the Denmark United Methodist Church, c/o Kevin Evans, 1733 St. Rt. 95, Edison, OH 43320.

 

Sarah married Living

1050 F vii. Margaret Martin [12378] was born on September 29, 1913 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA, died on June 28, 2003 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA at age 89, and was buried in Pleasant Grove, Belmont, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

Her obituary was published in the Times Leader [online] on June 30, 2003 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Margaret V. Martin, 89, of Mercer Road, St. Clairsville, Ohio, died Saturday, June 28, 2003 at East Ohio Regional Hospital, Martins Ferry, Ohio.

She was born in Martins Ferry, Ohio on Sept. 29, 1913, a daughter of the late Benjamin B. and Sarah L. (Mellott) Martin.

She was a retired beautician having worked for Martins Ferry Beauty Shop, Martins Ferry, for over 30 years.

She was a member of First Christian Church, Martins Ferry and the U. & I. Sunday School class. She was also a Sunday school teacher and a deaconess.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by four brothers, Vernon, Edward, Harry and Clarance Martin; two sisters, Norma Martin and Elsie Cochran.

She is survived by niece Jackie Lou Cochran, St. Clairsville with whom she resided and several nieces and nephews.

At the family's request there will be no visitation and graveside services will be held for family and friends at Holly Memorial Gardens, Pleasant Grove, Ohio, at 11 a.m. on Tuesday, July 1, with Terry Erwin officiating.

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in an article in the East Liverpool Review on November 11, 1952. NARA, Japan (AP) - Pvt. Homer Eugene Headley, 21, of Woodsfield, O., who received seven pints of whole blood after being wounded in Korea, is on his way to recovery at a United States Army hospital here. Pvt. Headley, a rifleman with the Second Division, was hit by enemy mortar fire while holding a defensive position. Steel fragments tore into his arms, chest and abdomen, inflicting serious and extensive wounds.

543. William Cyrus Foughty [745] (Angeline Mellott 4, Abraham 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on February 6, 1889 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA,526 died on July 20, 1956 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA at age 67, and was buried in Ebenezer Cemetery, Belmont County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on June 12, 1900 in Adams Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.514

He appeared in the census on April 19, 1910 in Adams Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.504

His obituary was published in the Zanesville Signal on July 21, 1956 in Zanesville, Muskingum, Ohio, USA. BARNESVILLE - Services for Cyrus W. Foughty, 67, of Malaga will be held at 2 o'clock (Eastern Standard Time) at the Campbell Funeral Home here. Burial will be in Ebenezer Cemetery near Bethesda. Mr. Foughty died Friday in Martins Ferry Hospital.

548. James Israel Mellott [12706] (William A. 4, James 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on October 20, 1872 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA,534 died on May 18, 1957 in Steubenville, Jefferson, Ohio, USA 534 at age 84, and was buried in Sugar Grove Cemetery, Jefferson County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Herald-Star in Steubenville, Jefferson, Ohio, USA. James I. Mellott, 84, of 205 Main St., father of Arthur Mellott of Steubenville, died Saturday night at Ohio Valley Hospital.

 

Mr. Mellott, a retired stationary engineer at the Toronto Paper Board Co. had been in failing health for the past month and hospitalized that same length of time.

 

He was affiliated with the Methodist Church.

A native of Beallsville, Ohio, he was born Oct. 20, 1872, a son of the late William and Lorinda Mellott.

 

He was married to the former Mary Dillon Jan. 11, 1984, and she survives with one son, Arthur of Steubenville; a daughter, Mrs. Violet Heckathorn of Toronto; and five grandchildren and eight grandchildren. A son and a daughter preceded him in death.

 

Friends are being received at the Clarke Funeral Home.

 

Services will be Tuesday at 2 p.m. with the Rev. Dominic Prosperi officiating. Burial will be in Sugar Grove Cemetery.

 

James married Mary Rachel Florence Dillon [12710] [MRIN: 3540] on January 11, 1894 in Toronto, Jefferson County, Ohio, USA.535 Mary was born on June 26, 1878 in Sugar, Tyler County, West Virginia, USA,535 died on September 26, 1971 in Steubenville, Jefferson, Ohio, USA 535 at age 93, and was buried in Sugar Grove Cemetery, Jefferson County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

Her obituary was published in the Herald-Star on September 27, 1971 in Steubenville, Jefferson, Ohio, USA. Mrs. Mary Mellott, 93, of 205 Main St., widow of James Mellott, died at 4:05 p.m. in Ohio Valley Hospital, Sunday.

 

Mrs. Mellott, a member of the Empire Methodist Church, was preceded in death by her husband James Mellott in 1957.

 

She leaves a son, Arthur Mellott of Wisconsin; four grandchildren, and a sister, Mrs. Luella Clendenning of Toronto.

 

Funeral arrangements are pending at the Clarke Funeral Home.

 

Children from this marriage were:

554. Elmer Welden Mellott [8366] (Reason Vanlaw 4, James 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on September 3, 1876 in Monroe County, Ohio 536 and died on October 17, 1965 in Cuyahoga Falls, Summit, Ohio, USA at age 89.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on June 9, 1880 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.536

He appeared in the census on June 9, 1900 in Pease Township, Belmont County, Ohio, USA.885

His obituary was published in the Times Recorder on October 17, 1965 in Zanesville, Muskingum, Ohio, USA. BARNESVILLE - Elmer W. Mellott, 89, of Akron, formerly of Barnesville, died at 6:47 a.m. after an illness in Green Cross Hospital in Cuyahoga Falls.

Born in Monroe County, Sept. 3, 1876, he was the son of Resson and Hanna Myers Mellott. His wife, Effie, died in May 1953.

He was a member of the First Christian Church of Barnesville, the Fraternal Order of Eagles and the Loyal Order of Moose.

Surviving are his son Orville with whom he lived in Akron; two brothers, Mancel of Pittsburg and Clyde of Steubenville; one sister, Mrs. Anna Landefeld of Canton and a half brother, Lumly Mellott of New Athens.

The body was taken to Campbell Funeral Home in Cambridge where friends may call today after 3 p.m. DST.

Services will be held Monday at 1:30 p.m. at the funeral home with Rev. Larry I. Miracle officiating. Burial will be in Southern Cemetery.

 

Elmer married Effie Sevard [11862] [MRIN: 3315]. Effie was born in February 1879 in Ohio and died in May 1953 at age 74.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in the census on January 9, 1900 in Pease Township, Belmont County, Ohio, USA.885

 

The child from this marriage was:

 

1174 M i. Orville Millard Mellott [11863] was born on January 12, 1900 in Ohio and died on June 9, 1984 in Dade County, Florida 886 at age 84.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on June 9, 1900 in Pease Township, Belmont County, Ohio, USA.885

 

Orville married Myrtle Douglas [12150] [MRIN: 3376] on November 8, 1922 in Belmont County, Ohio.887 Myrtle was born in 1898 and died in 1929 at age 31.

 

Orville next married Esther Lillian Neisz [11874] [MRIN: 3321] on July 20, 1949 in Newport, Campbell, Kentucky, USA. Esther was born on March 26, 1909 in Lewisville, Monroe County, Ohio, USA and died on October 6, 2003 at age 94.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

Her obituary was published in the News Journal on October 8, 2003 in Mansfield, Richland, Ohio, USA. BUCYRUS -- Esther Lillian Mellott, 94, of 1630 E. Southern Ave. died Monday, Oct. 6, 2003, at Fairview Manor. She was born March 26, 1909, in Lewisville, Ohio, to William John and Lillie Belle Schwartz Niesz. On July 29, 1949, she married Orville Milliard Mellott who, in addition to her parents, preceded her in death. Esther is survived by a sister, Evelyn Garrett of rural Bucyrus, and numerous nieces and nephews in this area. She was preceded in death by four sisters, Mabel Niesz, Estelle Claus, Gladys Barnes and Mildred Fankhauser. Esther attended school in Lewisville, Ohio, and later worked for The Goodyear Tire Co. for 38 years until her retirement in l968. Following her retirement she moved to Florida where she lived for the next 20 years. She has lived in Bucyrus in more recent years and was a member of Scioto United Methodist Church. She enjoyed card playing at Bucyrus Senior Citizens Center, loved following the Cleveland Indians, participated in bowling and was quite involved in ceramics and crocheting. Services will be held 11 a.m. Thursday at Wise Funeral Service, conducted by the Rev. Glory Pietila. Burial will be in Oakwood Cemetery. Friends may call on Wednesday from 4-7 p.m. at the funeral home. Memorials may be made to Scioto United Methodist Church, Fairview Manor or charity of the donor's choice.

Christman [9024] [MRIN: 2279] on January 1, 1938 in Monroe County, Ohio.910 Gilbert was born on December 12, 1904 in Calais, Monroe, Ohio, USA, died on May 13, 1998 in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA at age 93, and was buried on May 16, 1998 in Antioch, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He was buried at Unity Cemetery in Antioch, Monroe, Ohio, USA on May 16, 1998.

His obituary was published in the Monroe County Beacon in May 1998 in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA. Gilbert A. Christman, 93, of 37758 SR 800, Sardis, Ohio, died May 13, 1998, at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. He was born in Monroe County Ohio, December 12, 1904, a son of the late John W. and Clara Ackerman Christman. He was a retired farmer and a member of the Unity Baptist Church, Sardis. Surviving are two sons and daughters-in-law, Lester and Linda Christman of Sardis, Harry Dean and b also of Sardis; two daughters and sons-in-law, Ruth Ann Knowlton Ridgeway and Gerald Ridgeway of Sardis, Mary Katherine and David McIntire of Clarington, Ohio; three brothers, Howard Christman of Lewisville, Ohio, Herbert Christman of Summerfield, Ohio, Lee Christman of Quaker City, Ohio; three sisters, Helen Starr of Summerfield, Mary Hayes of Quaker City, Cleo Carpenter of Lewisville; 11 grandchildren, Pamela Cockran, Michael Christman, James A. Knowlton, Rebecca Ann Tinker, Matthew Christman, Angela Christman, Mark Christman, Tawnya Boyd, Clyde W. McIntire; a great- grandson, Justin Mitchel Boyd. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Theadora Mellott Christman, in September 1980; an infant son, Dwight; a granddaughter, Sandra Lea; a sister, Esta Burkhart. Friends were received May 15 at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services were held May 16, with Reverend Claye Folger officiating. Interment in the Unity Cemetery, near Antioch, Ohio.

684. Calvin Miller Mellott [7247] (Benjamin Franklin 4, Benjamin 3, Jacob 2, Theodorus 1) was born on December 11, 1878 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA,340 died on October 26, 1963 in Monroe County, Ohio at age 84, and was buried on October 29, 1963 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on June 10, 1880 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.721

He appeared in the census on January 2, 1920 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.952

His obituary was published in the Times Recorder on October 28, 1963 in Zanesville, Muskingum, Ohio, USA. BEALLSVILLE - Calvin N. Mellott, 84, of Beallsville Route 2, died at 3 p.m. Saturday at his home. A retired farmer, he was born near Beallsville Dec. 11, 1878, a son of Benjamin Franklin and Lualla Miller Mellott. He was a member of the Methodist Church, 50-year member of Sunsbury Lodge 362, F. and A.M., and for 30 years its secretary, was a member of the Eastern Star, served for 20 years on the Monroe County School Board and also at one time was a member of the Beallsville District School Board. Surviving are his widow, Mrs. Mary Jeffers Mellott; two daughters, Miss Marie Mellott of Columbus and Mrs. Sara Christman of San Antonio, Tex., and seven grandchildren. Services will be held at 1:30 p.m. Tuesday at the Methodist Church with Rev. Harvey McPheron assisted by Rev. Dennis Jones, officiating. Burial will be in Beallsville Cemetery. Eastern Star services will be held at 7 p.m. and Masonic services at 7:30 p.m. today at Harper-Campbell Funeral Home.

He was buried at Beallsville Cemetery in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA on October 29, 1963.

 

Calvin married Mary Elizabeth Jeffers [4142] [MRIN: 2458], daughter of Isaac N. Jeffers [3555] and Louisa Lapp [4098], on December 26, 1909 in Monroe County, Ohio.723 Mary was born on August 15, 1884 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA 711 and died on November 23, 1976 in Monroe County, Ohio at age 92.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in the census on June 25, 1900 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.953

She appeared in the census on January 2, 1920 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.952

She was buried at Beallsville Cemetery in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Children from this marriage were:

723. Frank E. Mellott [12024] (Edward Ellsworth 5, David 4, William 3, John Noah 2, Theodorus 1) was born on November 11, 1896 in Ohio and died on August 15, 1958 in Belmont County, Ohio 373 at age 61.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on April 28, 1910 in York Township, Belmont County, Ohio, USA.744

He appeared in the census on June 11, 1900 in York County, Pennsylvania.743

 

Frank married Mary Elizabeth Valachovic [15653] [MRIN: 4250]. Mary was born on December 14, 1906 in Bellaire, Belmont, Ohio, USA, died on May 18, 2005 in Shadyside, Belmont, Ohio, USA at age 98, and was buried on May 21, 2005 in Powhatan Point, Belmont, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

Her obituary was published in the Times-Leader [online] on May 19, 2005 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Mary Elizabeth Mellott, 98, of Shadyside, died Wednesday, May 18, 2005 in Shadyside Care Center. Mary was born Dec. 14, 1906, in Bellaire, Ohio, a daughter of the late John and Theresa Zelipsky Valachovic.

She was a retired Register Nurse from Bellaire City Hospital, a member of St. Mary's Catholic Church, Shadyside, a 1926 graduate of Wheeling Hospital School of Nursing, Wheeling Hospital Alumni Association, Catholic Woman's Club and St. Francis Society. She was preceded in death by her husband, Frank Mellott on Aug. 14, 1958, and a brother John Valachovic. Surviving are her son Francis (Joyce) Mellott of Shadyside, Ohio, three grandchildren Joseph (Stephanie) Mellott of Olathe, Kan., Rev. David Mellott of Columbia, Maryland and Sharon Mellott of Cincinnati, Ohio; two great grandchildren, Brianna Mellott and Adam Mellott; two sisters, Anne Kubinsky of St. Clairsville, Ohio and Josephine Staley of Port Orange, Florida. Family and friends will be received Friday, 3 to 5 p.m., and 6 to 8 p.m., at Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Home, 3900 Central Ave., Shadyside. Funeral Liturgy with Mass 10 a.m., Saturday in St. Mary's Catholic Church, Shadyside, with Fr. Frank Cronin officiating. Interment in Powhatan Point, Ohio. Vigil service 3:15 p.m., Friday in the funeral home. Memorial contributions may be made to St. Mary's Catholic Church, Shadyside, Ohio.

 

The child from this marriage was:

 

1374 M i. Living

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Times Leaders [online] on February 24, 2005 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Jackie M. Brown, 68, of Powhatan Point, died Tuesday, Feb. 22, 2005 at his home. He was born Oct. 14, 1936 in Powhatan Point, son of the late Jesse and Geraldine Mellott Brown. Jackie was a retired superintendent of the Powhatan Point Water Department. He was preceded in death by two brothers, Wesley Brown and Mar Shepherd. Surviving are three children, Crystal (Tom) Cox of Jacobs- burg, Mike Brown of Dilles Bottom and Rusty (Vivian) Brown of Powhatan Point; two sisters, Vivian Townsend of Woodsfield and Wanda Craig of Goodlettville, Tenn., and a brother, Edward Shepherd of Powhatan Point; six grandchildren and several nieces and nephews. Family and friends will be received at the Powhatan Cemetery Chapel on Friday, from noon until time of service at 2 p.m., with the Rev. Richard Hendrix officiating. Interment will follow in the Powhatan Cemetery. Memorials contributions may be made to the Brown family in Jackie's memory. Arrangements by the Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Homes and Crematory, 186 Main Street, Powhatan Point.

Noted events in her life were:

 

Her obituary was published in the Times-Leader [online] on September 22, 2004 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Easter Mellott, 94, Fairview, Ohio, died Tuesday at Barnesville Health Care Center. She was born March 21, 1910 at Bailey Mills, daughter of the late Brady and Sina (McMullen) Hayes. She was a member of Fairview Church of Christ, operator for the former Home Telephone Co. in Fairview and a homemaker. She was a beautiful seamstress and enjoyed flower gardening. On April 30, 1926, she married Paul Hubert Mellott, Sr., who died June 24, 1994. Her sister, Wilma Grimes and three brothers, Emory, Elmer, and Ronald Hayes also preceded her in death. Surviving are her son, Paul H. Mellott, Jr., of Fairview, Ohio; three grandsons: Russell Mellott of Grove City, Jeffrey Mellott of Cambridge and Randall Mellott of Fairview, Ohio and several nieces and nephews. Visitation, Friday, from Noon until 2 p.m., at Campbell- Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 N. Chestnut St., Barnesville, Ohio. 949. Harriet Anna Mellott [8029] (James C. 5, Joshua R. 4, Archibald 3, Peter 2, Theodorus 1) was born on November 7, 1915 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA,794 died on May 23, 2004 in Ashland, Ashland, Ohio, USA at age 88, and was buried on May 26, 2004 in Clarington, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in the census on January 9, 1920 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.794

She was buried at Clarington Cemetery in Clarington, Monroe, Ohio, USA on May 26, 2004.

Her obituary was published in the Times-Leader [online] on May 24, 2004 in Saint Clairsville, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Harriet Anna Saffle, 88, of Ashland, Ohio, formerly of Clarington, Ohio died Sunday morning, May 23, 2004 at her home. She was born on Nov. 7, 1915 in Beallsville, Ohio, the daughter of the late James and Julia Shaw Echelberry Mellott. She was a resident of Ashland for fifty years, having worked at U-Brand of Ashland for 26 years. She also worked for Ashland Rubber Products, Eagle Rubber and Rybolt Heating. She was a member of the Church of Christ Northend, the 20 Plus Club of U-Brand and loved growing her many plants and flowers. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband of 28 years Howard Saffle. They wed in 1936 and he died in 1966. Survivors include a daughter and son-in-law Faye and Jerry Campbell, a son Cecil Saffle, a son and daughter-in-law Roger and Sue Saffle all of Ashland, 10 grandchildren 21 great-grandchildren, 15 great-great-grandchildren, four sisters Mary Mellot and Edna Conner both of Powhatan Point, Martha McDougal of Big Prairie, Ohio and Ethel Carpenter of Jerusalem, Ohio. Family will receive friends on Wednesday from 1:00 p.m. until the time of service at 2:00 p.m. at Grisell Funeral Home, 125 Clarinda Dr., Clarington with Evangelist Marvin Henderson officiating. Interment in Clarington Cemetery, Clarington, Ohio. Memorial contributions may be made to Hospice of North Central Ohio, Inc. 1605 Country Road 1095, Ashland, Ohio 44805 or the Church of Christ Northend, 1228 Cottage St., Ashland.

 

Harriet married Howard E. Saffle [13109] [MRIN: 1064] in 1936. Howard was born on April 12, 1914 in Ohio and died on September 21, 1966 in Ashland, Ashland, Ohio, USA at age 52.

 

Children from this marriage were:

976. Arthur J. Hutchison [11787] (Flossa Anna Mellott 5, Joshua R. 4, Archibald 3, Peter 2, Theodorus 1) was born on November 28, 1922 in Monroe County, Ohio, died on June 11, 2004 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA at age 81, and was buried on June 14, 2004 in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Times Leader [online] on June 11, 2004 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Arthur "Sam" "Pops" Hutchison, 81, of Beallsville, died Friday, June 11, 2004 at his home. He was born Nov. 28, 1922 near Cameron, a son of the late Robert and Anna Mellott Hutchison. He was a retired farmer and a U.S. Army veteran of World War II. Arthur was held in a German Prisoner of War Camp from which he escaped after five and a half months. He was a member of the Church of Christ, Beallsville. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by an infant son, Arthur, Jr.; a brother and three sisters. Surviving are his wife of 52 years, Charlotte Brown Hutchison; seven sons, Lee (Lisa), Dale, Samuel (Corilda), Larry, Harold, and James Hutchison, all of Beallsville, and Gary of N.C.; three daughters, Mary Lucas of Beallsville, Betty (Jeff) Farr and Melissa (Todd) Cherry, both of N.C.; two brothers, James of New Matamoras and Carl "Nick" of Rittman; two sisters, Marjorie Foltz of Beallsville and Martha McIntire of Piedmont; 14 grandchildren and six great- grandchildren. Friends may call Sunday 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. and 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. at the Harper Funeral Home, Beallsville, where services will be held Monday at 1 p.m. Burial will follow in the Cameron Cemetery with full military honors by American Legion Post #768. Memorial contributions may be made to the Hutchison family, 49879 Hutchison Road, Beallsville 43716.

He was buried at Cameron Cemetery in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA on June 14, 2004.

 

Arthur married Living

 

Children from this marriage were:

1449 M ii. Living

1489 M v. Stanley E. Ault [11609] was born on May 24, 1922 in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA, died on December 17, 2001 in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA at age 79, and was buried on December 20, 2001 in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on April 10, 1930 in Adams Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.

His obituary was published in the Marietta Times on December 18, 2001 in Marietta, Washington, Ohio, USA. WOODSFIELD - Stanley E. Ault, 79, of 45308 Ohio 78, Woodsfield, died at 10:15 a.m. Monday (Dec. 17, 2001) at his home. He was born May 24, 1922, in Cameron, Ohio, to Stephen and Rachel Ady Ault. He was a retired farmer and a member of Woodsfield Church of Christ at Woodsfield. He was preceded in death by his parents; two brothers, Lester Ault and Floyd Ault; and two sisters, Vera McConnell and Erma Jones. He is survived by his wife, Mary Yost Ault, whom he married Aug. 16, 1940; three daughters, Hattie King and her husband, David, of Laings, Ohio, Jacqueline Ridgeway of Massillon and Annet Ollom Keeton of Adena; one son, Rick S. Ulrich at home; four brothers, Ralph Ault and his wife, Naomi, Clyde Ault and his wife, Martha Lee, Hilbert Ault and his wife, Eleanor, and Chester Ault and his wife, Donna, all of Woodsfield; one sister, Sylvia Jones and her husband, Ralph, of Woodsfield; six grandchildren, Mary Ann Campbell, April Crum, Savannah King, Gerald Ridgeway, Rachel Ridgeway and Elizabeth Keeton; five great-grandchildren, David King, Daniel Campbell, Ashley Campbell, Michael Crum and Walker Crum; and several nieces and nephews. He was preceded in death by his parents. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 Ohio 78 West, Woodsfield. Friends will be received at Woodsfield Church of Christ in Woodsfield from noon until time of services at 1 p.m. Thursday with Sam Bartrug officiating. Burial is in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield.

He was buried at Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA on December 20, 2001.

1010. James W. Ady [11087] (Ida M. Palmer 5, Elizabeth Mellott 4, Theodore W. 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on May 3, 1920 in Glencoe, Belmont, Ohio, USA, died on October 13, 2005 in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA at age 85, and was buried on October 17, 2005 in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on April 11, 1930 in Adams Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.

His obituary was published in the Intelligencer on October 15, 2005 in Wheeling, Ohio, West Virginia, USA. James W. Ady, 85, of State Route 78 East, Woodsfield, Ohio, died Thursday, Oct. 13, 2005 in the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. He was born May 3, 1920 in Glencoe, Ohio, the son of the late Everett and Ida Palmer Ady. He and his brothers were the co-owners and operators of A & L Drilling Company. He was also a member of the Radio Relay League, a U.S. Army veteran of WWII, and a Protestant by faith. He was an accomplished fiddle and guitar player, having been involved in numerous competitions yearly, and a Master Builder of Fiddles & Guitars. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Billie Jean Ady, three sisters, Stella Pittman, Amanda Ault, and Bessie Pletcher, and a brother, Henry Ady. Survivors include two daughters, Vivian L. (Larry) Dillon and Pamela J. Ensinger, both of Woodsfield, a sister, Eunice Brown, of Woodsfield, two brothers, Ralph (Doris) Ady and Glenn (Martha) Ady, both of Woodsfield, four grandchildren, Trudy D. Ensinger, Tracy Jo (Chris) Curtis, Douglas Ensinger, and Carrie D. (John) McClurg, six great grandchildren, several nieces and nephews, and a very special friend, Verna Fluharty of Colliers, WV. Family will receive friends on Sunday from 2 to 6 p.m. at Grisell Funeral Home, 125 Clarinda Drive, Clarington, Ohio where funeral services will be held Monday at 11:00 a.m. with Evangelist Jerry Yost officiating. Interment in Cameron Cemetery where American Legion Post #760 of Hannibal will conduct military graveside services.

He was buried at Cameron Cemetery in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA on October 17, 2005.

 

James married Billie Jean [15934] [MRIN: 4482]. Billie was born on November 5, 1929 and died on June 11, 1995 at age 65.

 

Children from this marriage were:

1025. Elizabeth M. Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in the census on January 12, 1920 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.831

Her obituary was published in the Times-LEader [online] on November 19, 2005 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Elizabeth G. Greenhalgh, 90, of the Broadview Health Center in Columbus, Ohio, formerly of Bellaire, Ohio, died Saturday, Nov. 19, 2005 in Columbus. She had been a former resident of the Eastland Manor for 14 years. She was born May 27, 1915 in Beallsville, Ohio, a daughter of the late Levi and Lenora Smith Mellott. She was a homemaker and member of the Bellaire Christian Church, Disciples of Christ and the Gender Road Christian Church. In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Charles Greenhalgh in 1985; one brother, George Mellott; and two sisters, Nellie Richards and Frances Rice. Surviving are her son, Kent Greenhalgh of Gahanna, Ohio; three grandchildren, Jennifer, Christopher, and Scott; and four great grandchildren, Katlin, Lauren, Courtney, and Cory. Family and friends will be received at the Bauknecht- Altmeyer Funeral Homes and Crematory, 441 37th Street, Bellaire, Ohio on Monday from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. where services will be held on Tuesday at 10 a.m. with the Rev. Richard Elwell officiating. Interment in the Linwood Cemetery at Blaine, Ohio.

She was buried at Linwood Cemetery in Blaine, Belmont, Ohio, USA on November 22, 2005.

1026. Nellie Grace Mellott [8233] (Levi Abraham 5, Theodore H. 4, Levi 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on July 17, 1917 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA,831 died on August 3, 2003 in Murfreesboro, Tennessee at age 86, and was buried in Clarington Cemetery, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in the census on January 12, 1920 in Sunsbury Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.831

Her obituary was published in the Times-Leader [online] on August 7, 2003 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Nellie Grace Collins Richards, 86, of Nashville, Tennessee, formerly of St. Clairsville, died Sunday, Aug. 3, 2003 in NHC Nursing Home, Murfreesboro, Tenn. She was born on July 17, 1917 at Beallsville, Ohio, daughter of the late Levi A. and Lenora Smith Mellott.

She was a member of the Calvary Presbyterian Church, St. Clairsville and a member of the Bridgeport Chapter #452, Order of Eastern Star.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her first husband, James G. Collins; and her second husband, former St. Clairsville City Councilman, William R. Richards; a sister, Frances Rice and a brother, George Mellott.

Nellie is survived by two daughters, Mrs. Tom Fleeman, Nancy J. Collins of Nashville, Tenn., and Barbara Richards Gorza of St. Clairsville; a son, Russell L. Richards of Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio; a sister, Elizabeth G. Greenhalgh of Columbus, Ohio; seven grandchildren and 12 great - grandchildren; nieces and nephews.

Family and friends will be received at the Toothman Funeral home in St. Clairsville on Thursday from 2 to 9 p.m., where services will be held on Friday, August 8, 2003 at 11 a.m., with Rev. Laurie Armstrong, officiating. Burial will follow in Clarington Cemetery, Clarington, Ohio.

He was a retired mechanic and a member of the Glencoe United Methodist Church. He was preceded in death by his wife, M. Pauline Jeffers in 1985. Surviving are eight sons, Paul, Howard, and James, all of Glencoe, Richard of Richmond, Ind., Robert of Jeromesville, Ohio, David of Ellisville, Miss., and Frank of Bethesda; three daughters, Pauline Ross of Flushing, Elaine Byrd of College Park, Md., and Marilyn Holland of Martins Ferry; 32 grandchilcren and 21 great grandchildren. Friends received at Toothman Funeral Home, St. Clairsville, 7-9 p.m., Monday, where services will be held at 10 a.m. Tuesday. Internment in Warnock Cemetery.

He was buried at Warnock Cemetery in Warnock, Belmont, Ohio, USA on April 28, 1987.

1252. Vera Margaret Mellott [8010] (Charles Michael 5, Harvey K. 4, Benjamin T. 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on August 20, 1916 in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA,613 died on February 5, 2004 in Canton, Stark, Ohio, USA at age 87, and was buried on February 9, 2004 in Canton, Stark, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She appeared in the census on January 14, 1920 in Adams Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.915

She appeared in the census on April 10, 1930 in Adams Township, Monroe County, Ohio, USA.

Her obituary was published in the Canton Repository on February 7, 2004 in Canton, Stark, Ohio, USA. Vera M. Sturms, age 87, of Canton, died Thursday evening in Canton Christian Home following an extended illness. She was born in Cameron, OH to the late Charles and Mayme (Ault) Mellott. She was a Canton area resident for the past 60 years and a member of 38th Street of Christ, where she was active with the Ladies Sewing Group and Stepping Stones. Preceded in death by her husband, Carl T. Sturms, in 1983; two brothers, Vernon and Grover Mellott. Survived by one son and daughter-in-law, Charles and Karen Sturms of Springfield, OR; one daughter and son-in-law, Karen and David Huggins of Canton; four grandchildren; six great-grandchildren; one brother and sister-in-law, Eugene and Faye Mellott of York, PA; one sister-in-law, Hazel Mellott of Rittman, OH. Services will be Monday at 1 p.m. in the Kreighbaum-Sanders Funeral Home, on S. Cleveland Ave., with Lance Lindenberger officiating. Interment in Sunset Hills Burial Park. Friends may call Sunday 2-4 p.m. in the funeral home.

She was buried at Sunset Hills Burial Park in Canton, Stark, Ohio, USA on February 9, 2004.

 

Vera married Carl Thomas Sturms [9468] [MRIN: 2945] on August 9, 1947 in Canton, Stark, Ohio, USA.613 Carl died in 1983.

 

Children from this marriage were:

1273. Harold W. Mellott [11795] (Benjamin T. 5, Nathan 4, Benjamin T. 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on November 17, 1921 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA, died on October 3, 2003 in Bellaire, Belmont, Ohio, USA at age 81, and was buried in Pleasant Grove, Belmont, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Times-Leader [Online] on October 4, 2003 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Harold W. Mellott, 81, of High Street, Bellaire, Ohio, died Friday, Oct. 3, 2003, at Belmont Community Hospital, Bellaire. He was born Nov. 17, 1921 at Martins Ferry, Ohio, a son of the late Ben and Pearl Piatt Mellott. He was a retired employee of the Standard Oil Company of Bellaire. A member of the American Legion Post 52 of Bellaire, a U.S. Army veteran of World War II and a Protestant by faith. In addition to his parents he was preceded in death by a brother Floyd Mellott. Surviving are his wife Frances Otto Mellott of Bellaire; two sons, Ron Mellott and his wife Rita of Bellaire, Dan F. Mellott and his wife Karen of Toronto, Ohio; five grandchildren, Tim Mellott, Tammy Mellott, Crystal LaRuffo, Ronnie Mellott and Dan J. Mellott; and five great grandchildren. Friends will be received Sunday from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m., at Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Home, 441 37th Street, Bellaire, Ohio, where services will be held on Monday at 11 a.m., with Pastor Don Cordery officiating. Burial follows at Holly Memorial Gardens, Pleasant Grove, Ohio. Full military graveside services will be conducted by the Belmont County Council of American Legions.

He was buried at Holly Memorial Gardens in Pleasant Grove, Belmont, Ohio, USA.

 

Harold married Frances G. Otto [1258] [MRIN: 2062]. Frances was born on January 31, 1923 in Burgettstown, Washington, Pennsylvania, USA and died on December 20, 2003 in Wheeling, Ohio, West Virginia, USA at age 80.

 

Noted events in her life were:

 

She was buried at Holly Memorial Gardens in Belmont County, Ohio on December 22, 2003.

Her obituary was published in the Herald-Star on December 22, 2003 in Steubenville, Jefferson, Ohio, USA. Frances G. Mellott, 80, of High Street, Bellaire, passed away Satur- day, Dec. 20, 2003 in Wheeling Hospital. She was born Jan. 31, 1923 in Burgettstown, Pa., a daughter of the late William and Bessie Woolard Otto. She was an employee of the former G.C. Murphy Co. of Bellaire; a member of the American Legion Post 52 Auxiliary in Bellaire; and a Protestant by faith. She was preceded in death by her husband, Harold W. Mellott on Oct. 3, 2003; two brothers, Cline and Albert Otto; and a sister Rachael Gordon. Surviving are two sons, Ron Mellott and his wife Rita of Bellaire and Dan F. Mellott and his wife Karen of Toronto; two brothers, William Otto of Pa., and George Otto of New Mexico; five grandchildren, Tim Mellott, Tammy Mellott, Crystal LaRuffo, Ronnie Mellott, and Dan J. Mellott; and five great-grandchildren. Friends received at Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Home, 441 37th Street, Bellaire, Monday at 11 a.m. until time of funeral service at 1 p.m. with Rev. Donald Cordery officiating. Interment at the convenience of the family in Holly Memorial Gardens.

1287. Glen D. Decker [9893] (John Alva Decker 5, Amanda Jane Mellott 4, David 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on October 8, 1915 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA, died on December 29, 2005 in Woodsfield, Monroe, Ohio, USA at age 90, and was buried on January 1, 2006 in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Times-Leader [online] on December 30, 2005 in Martins Ferry, Belmont, Ohio, USA. Glenn Decker, 90, of Beallsville, Ohio, died Thursday, Dec. 29, 2005 in the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. He was born Oct. 8, 1915 near Beallsville, a son of the late John Alva and Carrie Louise Jeffers Decker. He was a member of the Belmont Ridge Christian Church, an Army veteran of World War II and a retired carpenter. In addition to his parents, Glenn was preceded in death by five brothers, Argyle "Dick", Park, Forrest, Arby and Doyce; three sisters: Gladys Neiswonger, Edna Hamilton and Mary Haley. Surviving are his wife of 61 years, Bea Cecil Decker; two daughters, Penny (Dwight) Lucas of Beallsville, and Diana Hypes of Reynoldsburg; two granddaughters: Debbie (Duane) Gehring and Brenda (Scott) Bondy; four great- grandchildren: Shawn, Mat- thew, Nathan and Shane. Friends will be received Saturday at the Harper Funeral Home, Beallsville from 2 to 8 p.m., where funeral services will be held Sunday, Jan. 1, 2006 at 1 p.m., with Jim Russ officiating. Burial will follow in Beallsville Cemetery with full Military Honors.

He was buried at Beallsville Cemetery in Beallsville, Monroe, Ohio, USA on January 1, 2006.

1477. Everett Vernon Ady [15194] (Isaac Everett Ady 6, Charlotte Victoria Palmer 5, Elizabeth Mellott 4, Theodore W. 3, Theodorus 2, Theodorus 1) was born on February 23, 1933 in Cameron, Monroe, Ohio, USA and died on January 11, 2005 in Marysville, St. Clair, Michigan, USA at age 71.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

His obituary was published in the Times Herald on January 14, 2005 in Port Huron, St. Clair, Michigan, USA. MARYSVILLE -- Mr. Everett Vernon Ady, 71, of Marysville, died Tuesday, Jan. 11, 2005, in Mercy Hospital. He was born Feb. 23, 1933, in Cameron, Ohio, to the late Isaac "Everett" and Edna Ady. He married Kathleen Fagan on Aug. 18, 1956, in Warren, Ohio. Mr. Ady retired from Ogden & Moffet Trucking Co.'s sales department. He served in the U.S. Army during the Korean conflict. He was a 32nd Degree Mason and was High Twelve. He belonged to American Legion Charles Hammond Post 8 and loved to garden. Mr. Ady is survived by his wife, Kathleen; a son, Mr. and Mrs. Stephen (Linda) Ady of Port Huron; a son-in-law, Jeffrey Allen of Forester; seven grandchildren, Stephanie, Staci, Josh and Sarah Ady, Mr. and Mrs. Jason (Jennifer) Roberts, and Jessica and Shelby Allen; a great-grandchild, Ryleigh Roberts; five brothers, Mr. and Mrs. Harold (Barbara) Ady, Mr. and Mrs. Allen (Carol) Ady, Ray Ady, Mr. and Mrs. Tom (Ann) Ady and Mr. and Mrs. Rob (Tami) Ady; two sisters, Patty Ady and Mr. and Mrs. Jim (Cheryl) Wilson; and several nieces and nephews. He was preceded in death by his daughter, Julia Ann Allen; two sisters, Hazel Lichty and Sandra Ady; and two brothers, Joe and Roy Ady. Visitation will be from 10 a.m. until the time of the funeral service at noon Saturday, Jan. 15, 2005, in Pollock-Randall Funeral Home. The Rev. Joel Puntigam of Westminster Presbyterian Church will officiate. Those planning an expression of sympathy may wish to con-sider the Visiting Nurse Association.

 

Everett married Living

Noted events in her life were:

 

Her obituary was published in the Marietta Time in March 2002 in Marietta, Washington, Ohio, USA. BEVERLY - Mary Elizabeth Grodhaus Monroe, 69, of Seventh Street died at 8:05 a.m. Saturday (March 9, 2002) at Selby General Hospital in Marietta. She was born April 12, 1932, in Belmont County, Ohio, to William and Elizabeth Pollock Piper. She had lived in Beverly for more than 20 years. She was a Protestant by faith. She was a graduate of Shadyside High School. She enjoyed playing bingo and fishing. She is survived by three daughters, Karen S. Nunn of Beverly, Jean Hart and her husband, Tony, of Waterford and Penny White and her husband, Clark, of Moundsville, W.Va.; one son, William Edward Grodhaus of Ohio; 14 grandchildren; eight great-grandchildren; and one brother, William Piper and his wife, Patricia, of Shadyside. On Jan. 11, 1952, she married Charles Grodhaus. He died in August 1994. She later married Howard Nathan Monroe on May 9, 1996. He died Nov. 8, 1996. Also preceding her in death were one daughter, Linda Marie Grodhaus Cody; and one grandson, William Edward Grodhaus. Services are at 10:30 a.m. Wednesday at the Lowell Chapel of Cawley & Peoples Funeral Home with Merle Farnsworth officiating. Burial is in Beverly Cemetery. Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral home. Memorial contributions to help offset expenses may be made to the family in care of the funeral home, P.O. Box 400, Lowell, Ohio 45744.

Luther was born on August 6, 1926 in Hulbert, Crittenden, Arkansas, USA 997, 998 and died on August 18, 1997 in Portsmouth, Virginia 999 at age 71. The cause of his death was Pneumonia.

 

Noted events in his life were:

 

He appeared in the census on April 3, 1930 in Memphis, Shelby, Tennessee, USA.1000

He served in United States Navy from 1944 to 1967. A veteran of World War II. He served on various ships including USS Rockwall (APA-230), USS Tripoli (CVE-64), USS Coates (DE-685), USS Ticonderoga (CV-14), and USS Suribachi (AE-21). He retired after 24 years of honorable service in 1967 as a Chief Yoeman.

He graduated from Centralia High School in 1946 in Centralia, Marion, Illinois, USA.

He worked as an Auditor for Woodward & Lothrup Company from 1968 to 1987 in Washington, District Of Columbia.

He resided at Keystone Apartments on January 8, 1968 in Forestville, Prince George's, Maryland, USA.

He resided at 3 Topsail Lane from 1989 to 1994 in Garden City, Horry, South Carolina, USA.
